revised_title: Reconsidering the Computation of the Sun's Distance from Earth
tldr: The author, Samuel Horsley, reevaluates the computation of the Sun's distance from Earth using the theory of gravity. He finds that the mean quantity of the solar force affecting the moon's gravity towards the Earth is more imprecise than initially thought, but concludes that the theory is close to the observed values of the Sun's mean horizontal parallax.
